Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Esculentin-1A  (Esculentin-1PN, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: Edible frog,Pelophylax lessonae/ridibundus, old nameRana esculenta, also found in a dark-spotted frog,Pelophylax nigromaculatus, Europe

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: also found in Pelophylax nigromaculatus (Chen et al., 2024).Activity: Active against Gram- bacteria E. coli D21 (MIC 0.2 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 15692  (MIC 0.7 uM), Y. pseudotuberculosis YPIII (MIC 0.1 uM),  P. syringae pv tabaci (MIC 0.2 uM), E. agglomerans Bo-1S (MIC 0.4 uM), Gram+ bacteria B. megaterium Bm11 (MIC 0.1 uM), S. aureus Cowan I (MIC 0.4 uM), and fungi C. albicans clinical isolate (MIC 0.5 uM). Also active against V. harveyi ATCC33866 (MIC 25 ug/ml), V. alginolyticus ATCC17749 (MIC 25 ug/ml), V. anguillarum ATCC19264 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), C. freundii ATCC43864 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), S. fexneri (MIC 50 ug/ml), S. saprophyticus (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), and L. monocytogenes ATCC19115 (MIC 50 ug/ml) (see the 2024 ref above).MOA:bacteria:E. coli:  appeared to act on membranes.Toxicity: human RBC, lethal concentration >200 uM: not hemo.lytic (Ponti et al., 1999.SAR: The N-terminal 21-residue fragment has been extensively studied (see AP2872).Updated 10/2015; 5/2020; Jan2024; 7/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Simmaco M, Mignogna G, Barra D, Bossa F.1994
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from skin secretions of Rana esculenta. Molecular cloning of cDNAs encoding esculentin and brevinins and isolation of new active peptides.
